<<pre class="ocsforge_color odocwiki_code" id="TYPElinktypes"|<<span class="ocsforge_color_keyword"|type>> <<span class="odocwiki_name"|linktypes>> <<span class="ocsforge_color_delimiter"|~=>> <<span class="odocwiki_type"|\\  [ `Alternate\\  | `Archives\\  | `Author\\  | `Bookmark\\  | `External\\  | `First\\  | `Help\\  | `Icon\\  | `Index\\  | `Last\\  | `License\\  | `Next\\  | `Nofollow\\  | `Noreferrer\\  | `Pingback\\  | `Prefetch\\  | `Prev\\  | `Search\\  | `Sidebar\\  | `Stylesheet\\  | `Tag\\  | `Up ] list>> >><<div class="odocwiki_info"|~Authors may use the following recognized link types~, listed here with
        their conventional interpretations~. ~A ~Link~Types value refers to a
        space~-separated list of link types~. ~White space characters are not
        permitted within link types~.  ~These link types are case~-insensitive~, i~.e~.~,
        <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"~Alternate">> has the same meaning as <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"alternate">>~.


        ~User agents~, search engines~, etc~. may interpret these link types in a
        variety of ways~. ~For example~, user agents may provide access to linked
        documents through a navigation bar~.


        
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Alternate>>~:
        ~Gives alternate representations of the current document~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Archives>>~:
        ~Provides a link to a collection of records~, documents~, or other materials of historical interest~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Author>>~:
        ~Gives a link to the current document~'s author~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Bookmark>>~:
        ~Gives the permalink for the nearest ancestor section~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~External>>~:
        ~Indicates that the referenced document is not part of the same site as the current document~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~First>>~:
        ~Indicates that the current document is a part of a series~, and that the first document in the series is the referenced document~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Help>>~:
        ~Provides a link to context~-sensitive help~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Icon>>~:
        ~Imports an icon to represent the current document~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Index>>~:
        ~Gives a link to the document that provides a table of contents or index listing the current document~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Last>>~:
        ~Indicates that the current document is a part of a series~, and that the last document in the series is the referenced document~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Licence>>~:
        ~Indicates that the main content of the current document is covered by the copyright license described by the referenced document~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Next>>~:
        ~Indicates that the current document is a part of a series~, and that the next document in the series is the referenced document~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Nofollow>>~:
        ~Indicates that the current document~'s original author or publisher does not endorse the referenced document~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Noreferrer>>~:
        ~Requires that the user agent not send an ~H~T~T~P ~Referer ~(sic~) header if the user follows the hyperlink~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Pingback>>~:
        ~Gives the address of the pingback server that handles pingbacks to the current document~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Prefetch>>~:
        ~Specifies that the target resource should be preemptively cached~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Prev>>~:
        ~Indicates that the current document is a part of a series~, and that the previous document in the series is the referenced document~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Search>>~:
        ~Gives a link to a resource that can be used to search through the current document and its related pages~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Stylesheet>>~:
        ~Imports a stylesheet~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Sidebar>>~:
        ~Specifies that the referenced document~, if retrieved~, is intended to be shown in the browser~'s sidebar ~(if it has one~)~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Tag>>~:
        ~Gives a tag ~(identified by the given address~) that applies to the current document~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Up>>~:
        ~Provides a link to a document giving the context for the current document~.

>>
<<pre class="ocsforge_color odocwiki_code" id="TYPEmediadesc"|<<span class="ocsforge_color_keyword"|type>> <<span class="odocwiki_name"|mediadesc>> <<span class="ocsforge_color_delimiter"|~=>> <<span class="odocwiki_type"|\\  [ `All\\  | `Aural\\  | `Braille\\  | `Embossed\\  | `Handheld\\  | `Print\\  | `Projection\\  | `Screen\\  | `Speech\\  | `TTY\\  | `TV ] list>> >><<div class="odocwiki_info"|~The ~Media~Desc attribute is a comma~-separated list of media descriptors~.
        ~The following is a list of recognized media descriptors~:
        
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Screen>>~:
        ~For non~-paged computer screens~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~T~T~Y>>~:
        ~For media using a fixed~-pitch character grid ~(like teletypes~, terminals~, or devices with limited display capabilities~)~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~T~V>>~:
        ~For ~T~V~-type devices ~(low resolution~, limited scrollability~)~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Projection>>~:
        ~For projectors~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Handheld>>~:
        ~For handheld devices ~(small screen~, limited bandwidth~)~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Print>>~:
        ~For paged and for documents viewed on screen in print preview mode~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Braille>>~:
        ~For braille tactile feedback devices~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Aural>>~:
        ~For speech synthesizers~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~All>>~:
        ~For all devices~.



        # ~The value is a comma~-separated list of entries~. ~For example~,
        <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|media~="screen~, ~3d~-glasses~, print and resolution ~> ~9~0dpi">>
        is mapped to~: <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"screen">>~, <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"~3d~-glasses">>~,
        <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"print and resolution ~> ~9~0dpi">>~.
# ~Each entry is truncated just before the first character that
        isn~'t a ~U~S ~A~S~C~I~I letter <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|~[a~-z~A~-~Z~]>> ~(~I~S~O ~1~0~6~4~6 hex ~4~1~-~5a~,
        ~6~1~-~7a~)~, digit <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|~[~0~-~9~]>> ~(hex ~3~0~-~3~9~)~, or hyphen~-minus ~(hex ~2d~)~.
        ~In the example~, this gives~: <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"screen">>~, <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"~3d~-glasses">>~, <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"print">>~.
# ~A case~-insensitive match is then made with the set of media
        types defined above~. ~User agents may ignore entries that
        don~'t match~.  ~In the example we are left with <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"screen">> and
        <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"print">>~.




        ~Note~. ~Style sheets may include media~-dependent variations within them
        ~(e~.g~.~, the <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|~C~S~S ~@media>> consig~)~. ~In such cases it may be appropriate
        to use <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"media~=all">>~.
>>
<<pre class="ocsforge_color odocwiki_code" id="TYPEmultilength"|<<span class="ocsforge_color_keyword"|type>> <<span class="odocwiki_name"|multilength>> <<span class="ocsforge_color_delimiter"|~=>> <<span class="odocwiki_type"|[ `Percent of int | `Pixels of int | `Relative of int ]>> >><<div class="odocwiki_info"|~The value may be a ~Length or a relative length~. ~A relative length
        has the form <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"i~*">>~, where <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"i">> is an integer~. ~When allotting space
        among elements competing for that space~, user agents allot pixel
        and percentage lengths first~, then divide up remaining available
        space among relative lengths~. ~Each relative length receives a
        portion of the available space that is proportional to the integer
        preceding the <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"~*">>~. ~The value <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"~*">> is equivalent to <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"~1~*">>~. ~Thus~, if
        ~6~0 pixels of space are available after the user agent allots pixel
        and percentage space~, and the competing relative lengths are <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"~1~*">>~,
        <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"~2~*">>~, and <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"~3~*">>~, the <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"~1~*">> will be allotted ~1~0 pixels~, the <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"~2~*">> will be
        allotted ~2~0 pixels~, and the <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"~3~*">> will be allotted ~3~0 pixels~.
>>

>>
<<pre class="ocsforge_color odocwiki_code" id="TYPEnumber"|<<span class="ocsforge_color_keyword"|type>> <<span class="odocwiki_name"|number>> <<span class="ocsforge_color_delimiter"|~=>> <<span class="odocwiki_type"|int>> >><<pre class="ocsforge_color odocwiki_code" id="TYPEnumbers"|<<span class="ocsforge_color_keyword"|type>> <<span class="odocwiki_name"|numbers>> <<span class="ocsforge_color_delimiter"|~=>> <<span class="odocwiki_type"|<<a_api text="number" | type HTML5_types.number >> list>> >><<pre class="ocsforge_color odocwiki_code" id="TYPEfloat_number"|<<span class="ocsforge_color_keyword"|type>> <<span class="odocwiki_name"|float~_number>> <<span class="ocsforge_color_delimiter"|~=>> <<span class="odocwiki_type"|float>> >><<pre class="ocsforge_color odocwiki_code" id="TYPEpixels"|<<span class="ocsforge_color_keyword"|type>> <<span class="odocwiki_name"|pixels>> <<span class="ocsforge_color_delimiter"|~=>> <<span class="odocwiki_type"|int>> >><<div class="odocwiki_info"|~The value is an integer that represents the number of pixels of
        the canvas ~(screen~, paper~)~. ~Thus~, the value <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"~5~0">> means fifty
        pixels~. ~For normative information about the definition of a pixel~,
        please consult ~C~S~S~2~.
**See also** [[http://www.w3.org/TR/1998/REC-CSS2-19980512|~C~S~S~2]]\\
>>
<<pre class="ocsforge_color odocwiki_code" id="TYPEscript_"|<<span class="ocsforge_color_keyword"|type>> <<span class="odocwiki_name"|script~_>> <<span class="ocsforge_color_delimiter"|~=>> <<span class="odocwiki_type"|string>> >><<div class="odocwiki_info"|~Script data can be the content of the <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"script">> element and the
